definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)

sentences.english: He enjoys highlighting the stories of the underdogs—be they the Welsh or the Estonians.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡關注被征服者的故事，如威爾士或愛沙尼亞。

sentences.english: Estonia reclaimed its independence and seceded from the Soviet Union.
sentences.chinese: 愛沙尼亞要求歸還其獨立權並退出蘇維埃聯盟。

sentences.english: So the Estonian side is very glad at President Jiang's state visit to Estonia.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我們非常高興江主席來愛沙尼亞進行國事訪問。

sentences.english: The classic category was also won by an Estonian couple, Jaanus and Anneli Undrest, with a time of 1 minute, 12.27 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 這個組別的冠軍同樣被一對愛沙尼亞夫婦奪得。

sentences.english: All the focus is on Estonia and getting three points this week.
sentences.chinese: 所有的目光都在愛沙尼亞身上，這周我們要取得三分。

sentences.english: At least, that’s what a group of Estonian researchers are claiming.
sentences.chinese: 或者至少一組愛沙尼亞研究人員是這麼聲稱的。

sentences.english: He was then over Estonia, right over the German-Soviet front line.
sentences.chinese: 他在愛沙尼亞上空，正是蘇德前線上空。

sentences.english: And it is that sort of Estonian quirkiness that gives the LMC its pull.
sentences.chinese: 正是愛沙尼亞這種與衆不同使LMC吸引各國前往。

sentences.english: Estonia lies on the eastern shores of the Baltic Sea on the level northwestern part of the rising east European platform.
sentences.chinese: 愛沙尼亞位於東歐洲平原高地西北方的波羅的海東岸。

definition: Moldova/Republic of Moldova, former Soviet republic on the border with Romania
